Equatorial Guinea are favored to come out on top based on individualities.
Guinea booked their place in the round of 16 as one of the four best third-placed teams.
Equatorial Guinea are a free-scoring side, boasting the highest number of goals so far – nine.
Equatorial Guinea striking star Emilio Nsue is currently the tournament’s top scorer with five goals.
Guinea are in search of their first title, with their best record being a runners-up spot in the 1976 edition.
Equatorial Guinea are expected to stick to their aggressive style of play backed by an unflagging physicality and stamina.
Guinea’s defense has come under fire for poor coordination. Coach Kaba Diawara has promised to fix the holes ahead of this meeting.
Guinea opened their campaign with an inspiring 1-1 draw against Cameroon but suffered a 2-0 setback in their follow-up game against title holders Senegal.
